content.description: Traverse right to left on topside jugs all the way up to the tree on the other side of the boulder. Potential for top out before tree or battle with the palo verde to keep going. Sustained at the grade.
content.location: Takes up the entire northern side of El Hueco Sucio boulder

content.description: Sit start pull on crux that goes up pinches and pockets to top out
content.location: The right (west) side of El Hueco Sucio boulder.

content.description: Crux hanging start is possibly the hardest move on this side of the boulder. In one, long striding move, you basically go from hanging on the starting jug to having your feet on it. Getting the starting footing and pulling on is the crux.
content.location: Start on the jug to the left of the dirty hole on El Hueco Sucio boulder (to the left of "The Black Whole").

content.description: Two moves. Pulling on and getting left foot up top. Sit start variation probably more like V3-4
content.location: Start left of the large black jug and go straight up on sharp holds. (left of "Hueco Sucio Left")

content.description: Go straight up the easiest route on the northwestern face. V0- move pulling on and then low angle v-easy to top out.
content.location: start on jugs and ledge on northwestern tip of El Hueco Sucio boulder

content.description: Crux sit start on the dirty hole that proceeds up pockets and fun easy moves to top out.
content.location: Start under the dirty hole in El Hueco Sucio.

content.description: A nice little boulder with a few easy and short but fun problems and one longer traverse. Most lines feature a crux sit start and follow pockets and/or positive holds to a top out. Walk off the southern side of the boulder.
